description: Japanese boxwood (Buxus microphylla var. japonica) is an amazing plant species that is native to Japan. This stunning evergreen shrub has a neat, dense growth habit and glossy leaves. Plus, it's highly adaptable, able to thrive in many different soil types and sunlight conditions. Japanese boxwood grows slowly and can reach up to 3 feet high and 5 feet wide when mature. The foliage is bright green and can be easily trimmed into other shapes. Beyond that, it's incredibly low maintenance, requiring no special care or fertilizer. Japanese boxwood is an easy-care and versatile shrub that can be enjoyed in any garden.
